screen_desc: The screenshot displays the "Languages & Input" settings on an Android device. It shows the current language as "English (United States)" and offers options for configuring keyboards. The "Virtual keyboard" section includes Gboard and Google voice typing, while the "Physical keyboard" section lists AT Translated Set 2 and QWERTY2. There is also an "Advanced" section with further keyboard settings like pointer speed and text-to-speech tools.
action_think: The user wants to change the appearance or settings of the keyboard. The current screen shows the 'Languages & input' section, with both virtual and physical keyboard settings available. The next step would be to navigate to the 'Virtual keyboard' section to adjust the appearance of the virtual keyboard, such as Gboard settings. Since Gboard is listed under 'Virtual keyboard,' I will select it to begin making changes to its look.
action_plan: Click on the 'Gboard' option under 'Virtual keyboard' to proceed with changing the keyboard appearance.
action_desc: Click on the 'Gboard' option under 'Virtual keyboard' to proceed with changing the keyboard appearance.
action_result: By clicking on the "Virtual keyboard" settings, the screen now presents options for customizing the keyboard appearance. This action directly helps to complete the user request because the user is now in the correct menu where they can adjust the look of the keyboard, such as changing themes or key styles. Therefore, progress has been made toward changing the keyboard's appearance.
prev_action_result:
By clicking on the "Languages & input" option, I have navigated to the settings where you can adjust the input methods for the device. The current screen now shows the "Keyboards" section, which includes options like "Virtual keyboard" (Gboard and Google voice typing) and "Physical keyboard" settings. 

This action has made progress toward completing your request because, in this menu, you can further adjust the appearance and settings of the virtual keyboard (Gboard), which is related to changing the keyboard's look.
